title: Decay estimates for Beam equations with potentials in dimension three
abstract:
This paper is devoted to studying time decay estimates of the solution for Beam equation (higher order type wave equation) with a potential
  $$u_{t t}+\big(Δ^2+V\big)u=0, \,\ u(0, x)=f(x),\ u_{t}(0, x)=g(x)$$ in dimension three, where $V$ is a real-valued and decaying potential on $\R^3$. Assume that zero is a regular point of $H:= Δ^2+V $, we first prove the following optimal time decay estimates of the solution operators \begin{equation*}
  \big\|\cos (t\sqrt{H})P_{ac}(H)\big\|_{L^{1} \rightarrow L^{\infty}} \lesssim|t|^{-\frac{3}{2}}\ \ \hbox{and} \ \
  \Big\|\frac{\sin(t\sqrt{H})}{\sqrt{H}} P_{a c}(H)\Big\|_{L^{1} \rightarrow L^{\infty}} \lesssim|t|^{-\frac{1}{2}}. \end{equation*} Moreover, if zero is a resonance of $H$, then time decay of the solution operators above also are considered. It is noticed that the first kind resonance does not effect the decay rates for the propagator operators $\cos(t\sqrt{H})$ and $\frac{\sin(t\sqrt{H})}{\sqrt{H}}$, but their decay will be dramatically changed for the second and third resonance types.
